reviewText:
A decent game from more than a decade ago. But it may not be the game for you considering how long my con list is.

Pros:

1.) The environment is nice and it's fun to explore around.

2.) There's a good amount of weaponry, ranging from a Desert Eagle to a rare and powerful automatic shotgun, the Pancor Jackhammer. If you favor stealth, pick a silenced MP5 and remain hidden.

3.) There aren't that many vehicles but it's forgivable if you can drive something that fires rockets and wrecks entire campsites.

4.) The A.I. enemies are impressive to fight against. Some operate like a squad and they tend to think" (or pick stealth) more before assaulting your position.

5.) In my opinion
date: Far Cry offers outstanding music. It builds up and increases tension which is appropriate when you're exposed to assailants.\n\n6.) Graphics are nice
recommended:
considering this game is over 10 years old.



However

there are problems that Far Cry has.

reviewText:
Overal rating: 8/10

Good:
+Story
+Multiplayer (used to be good a long time ago)
+Good graphics for it's time
+Mods
+Trigons
+No Uplay
+Crytek engine
+Soundtrack

Bad:
-Small arsenal of weapons and cars available
-Bugs in 1.4 version that were not before
-Soldiers freezing (1.4 bug)
-Sound glitches (1.4 bug)
-Stupid AI sometimes (1.4 bug)
-Can't scope and re-aim on someone, it automatically unscopes (1.4 bug)
-Windows Vista and newer problems, missing textures and stuff

Conclusion:
I used to play this Far Cry a long time ago DRM FREE and finished it 3-4 times, and I decided to get it on steam and play once again because I'm not feeling like I'm gonna play it ever again, I enjoyed it to be honest, but there's something missing, it feels like different game, a lot of bugs from 1.4 version patch that are just not acceptable, soldiers can shoot through walls and stuff not knowing you're there etc. I'm still giving this game quiet good rating because it's a classic, also it brings so much memories, for it's time it was an awesome shooter, nowadays not everyone will enjoy this kind of game, honestly it's not the game for everyone. Not everyone can understand classic Far Cry at all, gamers nowadays care just about graphics.

Despite not taking place in an open-world" like its successors

reviewText: Even though this game is over 10 years old, it still looks beautiful. The graphics is actually so good, that is outshines some games released a decade later. But, there is always a butt! It takes too long before the story begins, and when it does, it is not very good. The A.I. is very stupid, and clearly programmed to not see you while you are moving in the vegetation. Other than that, they have no problems spotting you trough tents, bunkers and walls. They are also able to spot you further away than you can see, so you will have to use the binoculars to see who is shooting at you. I do not get the part with the mutants, it just feels weird. Other than that the game is pretty entertaining. The levels are a mix between “open world” (semi-open world with different paths that leading to the same goal) and linear. The game mechanics are good, which makes the game enjoyable. The hitboxes are good for a game this old, and you are rewarded for steady aim. The variation in weapons is not great, but it is good enough (should have been more weapons with silencer).

reviewText:
Reading the negative reviews for this has upset me a little.  It seems that the two main complaints people have are that the game is too hard and the story is somewhat lame.

I would agree that this is a hard game, it does not baby the player.  There is no regenerating health, the enemy soldiers move quickly and have decent aim.  I am not great at FPS games, but playing this game on medium is very enjoyable to me.  The checkpoints are very well spaced.  There are just enough health and armor packs.

If you are getting stuck in one spot I would suggest trying a different approach.  Maybe even back up one checkpoint and come it things from a different angle.  This is very different from the modern corridor shooters.  The maps are enormous and you are free to go anywhere.  I can see how this could be confusing for younger gamers used to COD style gameplay.  Boats and trucks are an excellent strategy with their mounted guns.  Stealth works very also.  Early game with the M16 switching to single shot mode, going prone and headshots from a distance is another good method.  Rushing in and spraying bullets will not work as well.

You will have ample ammo for your pistol and assault rifle, but much less for speciailzed weapons like the sniper rifle and rpg.  This keeps things balanced and rewards the player for good planning.

Final comments on the difficulty.  Everyone has different levels of skill.  For me on he hardest difficulty levels I can not get very far without getting stuck.  On medium the game is fun and I die maybe a couple times per level.  Select the level appropriate for your abilities.  Once you learn where the enemies are and how many that will give you an advantage.

Technologically this game is a masterpiece.  Released 10 years and still looks great.  It is the predecessor to Crysis.  As for the story, who cares?  It is a game not a movie.  It is about the gameplay here.  Cut scenes are few and far between and non disruptive.  Nothing gets between you and pulling that trigger.  There are no QTE's or moments where the game takes control away from you.  It is a very pure experience.

reviewText: The first thing to remember about this game is that it is over 10 years old.  However, 10 years later, it is still a great game to play.  The graphics are really nice for such an old game, and the envorinment is great.  The foliage and varying terrain provide great cover and lookout spots.  However, I do think the game misses out on a destructible environment, but this is mostly due to its age.  I would also call it open world, but it it does have linear aspects.  By this, I mean that there can be several routs and combinations you can employ to achieve objectives, but all of them guide you to the objective (i.e. an island will have 3 to 5 paths to get to the center, and each path will suit a different play style).  When you get inside places like the labs, the mission will become linear.  Personally, I was not bothered by this because that is how I feel it should work.  In real life, buildings are not supposed to have complicated floor plans, and it mixed it up from the open outside areas.  Together, these two set different tones and forced you to alter your play style and rely on different tactics.\n\nWhat I was most impressed by in this game was was the A.I.  They actually  act like thinking people in a lot of situations.  An example of this is them listening" for your footsteps and other noises you make.  Another example is that they will operate in groups or squads
date: and will often to choose tactical approaches to get to you
hoursPlayed:
but to me it makes the game feel more "real" and creates a fun challenge.

Another thing I think the game gets right is the music.  It is incredible.  It comes on at appropriate times at the right volume for the perfect amount of time.  It does not take away fromt the game at all.

Some of my final thoughts on the game include the voice acting

reviewText:
Somewhere during the late 90s and early 00s, first-person shooters grew increasingly more linear and tightly-scripted. This was largely due to the development time required for a relatively small team to create more open, non-linear environments with complex 3D architecture. As much as I enjoyed some of these linear shooters (No One Lives Forever and Star Trek Voyager: Elite Force spring to mind), I was starting to miss the days where I could walk into a room and discover three or more doors leading out of it. Also a little nervous that non-linear shooters were a thing of the past.

Thankfully Far Cry allayed those fears from the get go, presenting the player with nearly endless vistas, huge islands to be explored, enemy encounters that could be approached in a variety of ways. It felt like a brand new yet also warmly nostalgic gaming experience.

Far Cry was the first game I chose to play on a newly-built PC system back at the start of 2005. I also had Half-Life 2, Doom 3, Quake 4, Thief: The Deadly Shadows and Deus Ex: Invisible War waiting in the wings. Far Cry came free with the video card, so I decided to get it out of the way" first
date: only to end up entranced for about 12-15 hours and finding it to be one of the strongest of that particular set of unplayed games.\n\nThank you
hoursPlayed: for helping bring back non-linear environments to the FPS genre at a time when it desperately needed them."

reviewText:
Well, you should know that this game is the FPS version of Dark Souls. You're gonna die a lot. If you like the games where the victory is simply served to you, you should avoid this game.
Now the real rewiev:

+The graphics are pretty good for a game that was made 10 years ago.
+The game is really hard, which makes it better because after you beat a part you were stuck for a while, you feel rewarded.
+The story is very well thought even though it's not really realistic for a man to slaughter his way up to the end.
+There is a plot twist at the end, which I didn't see it coming and was surprised.
+It isn't short. I finished the game on medium difficulty in 14 hours.

-There is a glitch in the game, that makes you visible even when you are in a tent or hiding in bushes.
-The enemies just start to shoot at you from meters away, when it is actually impossible for them to even see you coming.
-You can't really sneak because the enemies hear the lightest footstep and start shooting at you.
-There is not enough checkpoints, so if you die at a point you have to redo all the thing even it was incredibly hard.

Do I recommend this game? Hell, yeah. If you want a good challenge while playing a good game, get this gem.

reviewText:
Far Cry was Crytek's flagship game, and they definately left a lasting impression on the gaming industry as a whole.

The maps are gigantic tropical islands that you tend to explore only 10% of by going through the linear path. There's a huge amount of detail and a map editor to design your own islands with.

That's not counting the single player experience itself. Which teaches you by experience rather than a tutorial. Inorder to take out a base of enemies you have to use stealth tactics and guerilla warfare, all of which take thinking and strategy to properly pull off. Picking the game up today will result in dying very often due to the intelligent AI, but you'll adapt, conquer, and survive. Playing this game is indeed like being on a vacation.

reviewText:
Far Cry is a first-person shooter action game developed by Crytek and published by Ubisoft in 2004. It was a surprise for its advanced graphics engine and artificial intelligence .

Jack Carver, a retired soldier, is hired by Valerie to explore an island. On the island, Doctor Krieger is involved in a genetic engineering project called Far Cry" guarded by large numbers of mercenaries. There are also primates undergoing genetic serum treatment that converts them into aggressive monstrosities. The game is extensive and has a remarkable variety of levels for the time.

The graphics engine was called CryEngine and it was a revolution at the time. It could show the outside world and vegetation in great detail. The image quality was surprising because everyone expected the best games to come from the hand of Id Software
date:
Valve or Unreal . Far Cry managed to surpass these industry monsters on open outdoor environments. At that time one was stupefied seeing and walking the surrounding rainforest. Handling vehicles added an interesting gameplay add on.
The experience of hang gliding on tropical islands was unique and later copied by several games like the wonderful 2013 Far Cry 3Game.

The game was released for Windows PC with recommended CPUs from 2 to 3 Ghz
recommended:
1 GB of RAM and 128 MB graphics cards supporting DirectX 9.0b . Many video cards suffered enough with this game in 2004.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

reviewText:
As fun as I remember it and that was 10 years ago believe it or not.

The enemy AI is great, some units will team up and attempt to sneak up on you while others will directly attack you head on. In certain camps the enemies will fire through their tents even if they can't see you. (bug)

The maps are really large, excluding the indoor ones and it isn't as open world as Far Cry 2 or 3 but it's still great. There also isn't any working multiplayer either just to add, but that isn't suprising considering its age.

The laughable voice overs and cheesy dialogue is an added bonus. :)

+Buy it on sale for the best value or pay full price if your a boss+

reviewText: Even though this game is over 10 years old, it still looks beautiful. The graphics is actually so good, that is outshines some games released a decade later. But, there is always a butt! It takes too long before the story begins, and when it does, it is not very good. The A.I. is very stupid, and clearly programmed to not see you while you are moving in the vegetation. Other than that, they have no problems spotting you trough tents, bunkers and walls. They are also able to spot you further away than you can see, so you will have to use the binoculars to see who is shooting at you. I do not get the part with the mutants, it just feels weird. Other than that the game is pretty entertaining. The levels are a mix between “open world” (semi-open world with different paths that leading to the same goal) and linear. The game mechanics are good, which makes the game enjoyable. The hitboxes are good for a game this old, and you are rewarded for steady aim. The variation in weapons is not great, but it is good enough (should have been more weapons with silencer).

reviewText:
Quick Review: This game is harder to survive than the Holocaust



FAR CRY® REVIEWYou're Jack Carver, a man who is looking for some researcher lady or something. I know, the story is gripping.
That's about it... Oh, and the game is open world.

The Goods

It was made in 2004, so it can run well on your 4 year old hipster laptop.
It's open world.
Really smooth gameplay and such.
Old, but nice graphics.
Difficulty is insane, even on the lowest option. (Adds playtime)

The Bads
Steam update broke the stealth mechanics
AI issues and such.

Final Score 9/11 I would check this gameout, it's worth the price and it's a total singleplayer blast.

reviewText:
Being the first entry in the series, this game makes honour to its name. Despite being quite old, it still manages to be a good game, although it presents several problems that impact negatively against its overall quality. The AI, for example, while good for flanking the player and working together, feels unfair since they can see the player through walls, and they spot you quite easily, so stealth isn't as fun as it should.

There's a good variety of enemies to fight, with different weapons and skills, but, as mentioned, there are problems with them. Another problem is that some can kill you quite easily before you even spot them. As for weapons, there's different types, and they all work very good.

The environments are impressive. From beaches, to old Japanese bunkers (and ships) from WWII, going through jungles, swamps, and even a volcano, this island has everything; and you can use several vehicles to move around.

As far as the story goes, it's like a cheesy 90s action film. Not to say that's bad, since it really fits the tone of the game; and, let's be honest, jumping out of a jeep as it falls from a cliff towards the ocean is something that makes you feel awesome.

All in all, I recommend it, even though it made me rage a bit.

reviewText:
Far Cry 1 is the 1st coming and presuccesor of Crysis 1, the 2nd coming of insane graphic game of 2007.

The core gameplay of this game is stealth, using environmental area such as bush or tree to fully cover and take out enemies sealthly. Player must use this sealth mechanic for your survival to avoid  getting fully detect or ortherwise you will lost your health quickly, especially in Realistic difficulty that you can die in very few second. And also use your movement, tools, and equipment to the highest tactical and you will have chance to beat the Realistic difficulty.

The graphic is great, CryEngine 1 display the area in such a realistic way, even in 2015 and still one of the best looking game of all time.

Overall, Far Cry 1 is one of the best realistic FPS gunplay with the environmental object that can use its advantage for stealth cover without getting detect. And also one of the heardest single campaign FPS game ever exist.

Great game from Crytek that you should try to play.

reviewText:
Overwview : If you are more than 14 years old then you must remember the classic Far Cry 1 !!!
It was way before there was a crysis & the game just came out with cry engine (CryTek) & the massive open world was so big that most players had to upgrade their VGAs to 128 mega byte cards !
Thats right back then 128 Mega byte was HUGE amount of memory for a vga...

Gameplay : even right now betweeen good (FPS) games like unreal tounament, crysis, battlefield, etc... Far Cry stands out !
It's smooth tracking for cursor gives the player a true PC FPS experience...

The way the enemies evolve with ur playstyle is amazing, they get stronger to further challenge you, if you play too well... ( not a lot of games has this even now days )
the game does not simply raise the difficulty level, a good program is written too handle this...

The Story : The story is solid, it doesnt evolve the guy turning sides at the last seconds.... like boring games....

The character of the player is believable and has a voice that goes along with visuals and bring it more to life....

Is It For You Or Not ? : If you love FPS games that rely on actuall true gameplay and aiming you will enjoy this game...
Even the graphics are good now because the game was ahead of its time when released...
If you liked crysis, you will like this too.

i give this game 9.1/10

Reviewed By IMMORTALEADER

reviewText:
Far Cry  is a classic FPS that started the Far Cry franchise that people know and love. I wanted to play the original because I wanted to check out the franchise's origins and see if the game held up.

Overall, the game is pretty entertaining. I will warn you though that of the five difficulties, the hardest is extremely hard and you will have to min/max in order to beat the game in a timely manner. When I played, I played on the normal difficulty (3 of 5), which took me about 15 hours to beat.

The humor in the game is a little campy, but is enjoyable to laugh at if you don't take the game seriously.

Overall I recommend playing it if you enjoy shooters and you found yourself wondering about if the game still holds up in 2015.

reviewText:
My god! It has really been 10 years since this game was released! It truly is unbelievable how time flies!

Anyway, this is one of those FPS games that I consider a milestone in the genre. Came out around the same time as Half Life 2 and Doom 3 did. I remember playing FPS games with corridors and relatively big rooms but never a game where you have a completely open island at your disposal and you can go wherever you want. Also, the game's engine handled these scenes very well and the frame per sec value did not drop significantly once you left a building and were in the open.

The story is quite silly, actually. You escort a journalist to an island then suddenly a rocket destroys your boat. Now, being stranded on this island, your only chance of survival is to go deep into the jungles. You'll soon find out why there are so many mercenaries with several bases here and what cruel experiments they've been conducting for a while.

The game was really beautiful at the time and beside the open-door areas it gave you the option to commandeer vehicles. This was also new at the time and this was refined later on in Crytek's Crysis.

As much as I thought the story of Far Cry was lackluster I thoroughly enjoyed this game and did several walkthroughs.

reviewText:
Despite being a 10 year old game, FarCry still manages to impress with its dated graphics and gameplay mechanics. Games back then struggled to balance gameplay with open worlds as most computers at that time simply could not handle the processing power. Yet Crytek and Ubisoft decided to take that extra step and prove everyone that they could make a giant game for its time.

There is no question that the islands that you play on are huge. While the game is not true “open world” per say, it still offers amazing space to test out your strategies. The game is linear in a sense that you progress through “zones”. Each zone has its own small enemy settlements, vehicles, and random events. Some zones are very linear while others promote exploration and different use of tactics. This is where FarCry is at its best. FarCry becomes so much fun when you as the player can figure out your own strategy in how to take down the enemy. Will you fly above your enemies and try to land on their base? Drive up in a armored vehicle and blast your way through? Perhaps take the underground passage and surprise your enemy. Or simply drag your enemy out into the jungle where you pick one by one.

Yet there are moments where FarCry will feel like a totally different game. Halfway through you are forced to play within confined walls and shoot “Trigens” or mutated human soldiers who do ridiculous jumps and can one shot you, making gameplay extremely frustrating. To make it even worse, the game’s autosave feature saves seldom, making dying even more infuriating. Luckily, this can be fixed by a quick in console command.

Make no mistake, FarCry is a very difficult game. Perhaps one of the most difficult I have ever played on hard. But it isn’t the “fun” type of difficult. It’s more of the bullcrap type where enemies have unlimited rocket launchers, grenades, and machinegun ammo while you run out quickly. Additionally, the game breaking bugs such as enemies spotting you behind walls and managing to shoot you behind tents and knowing exactly where you are makes stealth rather useless. It’s as if the game is taunting you that it could be much better had stealth actually worked.

The game’s story is nothing noteworthy as it suffers from stereotypical clichés, boring characters, and a villain who makes little to no sense. FarCry does, however, do a good job in making you feel like a predator throughout the game. At times, you can feel the effect you have on the world as your enemy gets more and more frightened by you.

Last but not least, the game has some serious glitches that makes gameplay infuriating. Saving during the zone called “Swamps” and loading is not possible after the car chase as the save always becomes corrupt. The only way to complete that part is to simply not die. Which when you play on hard, is not very easy to do. Additionally, the BS enemies who can snipe you miles away while you cannot even see them within distance is another part of the game which may make you want to throw your controller or mouse at the monitor. For being a 10 year old game, Ubisoft sure has not spent time in fixing some of these serious glitches, and it’s a problem since they are selling the game with these glitches.

Overall, unless you are a classic FPS lover who wants to experience the very roots of the FarCry franchise, you won’t be finding much here. FarCry is both fun and maddening, and the bugs certainly do not help. It can be fun, however, to try the open zones and play the game when it is at its best. I certainly recommend that.

Score: 6/10

reviewText: One of the classic FPS games that set the new standard in gameplay and graphics in its time.  The jungle scenery and island panoramic views were and still are breathtaking.  The ability to take a different approach to a single situation rather than being led on a rail to each action segment made the game very flexible for many players.  Once you enter the hallways though, the game turns more into a Doom clone where you only have one path to choose and you are faced with a new type of enemy that again evokes memories of Doom.  As a whole the story is interesting and gives you meaning to why you are fighting for your life.  I like your companion that helps you throughout the game to give you directions on where to go and what to do as well as giving background to the storyline.  The storyline consists of your boat, while on vacation, being shot down as you travel near an island.  You recover in the island and start playing cat and mouse to survive only to realize that this was no accident and the crew of your boat were purposely near that island.  But why?  What is so important about THIS island?  Play and find out, definitely a classic for all gamers to experience at least once.

reviewText:
Summary: A challenging, but rewarding and realistic old-school FPS.

Sale Price: $2.50 (what I paid)

Pros:
-The difficulty (I'll count this as a pro). I played it in the middle difficulty (out of five) and it was, by far, the hardest FPS I've ever played. The whole game forces you to rely on split-second timing and perfect long-distance aiming to survive. This makes you much more tense than newer FPS with regenerating health ever seem to do. You're often forced to methodically clear areas slowly and precisely, which is much different than most run-n-gun games these days. Far Cry 3's hardest difficulty was significantly easier than this.
-The stealth works very well. Your only chance at survival is to creep around in the woods. The attention meter" is your best friend. Also your night-vision goggles are essential at spotting enemies in the distance and in the dark.
-The AI is very advanced for the time. The bad guys will sound alarms to bring in help (which was reused in FC3)
recommended: they do occasionally do stupid things that shows how old the AI is

votesTotal:
and it shows here.

Cons:
-There's no quick-save

reviewText: The Far Cry series has changed considerably over the years, it's quite apparent looking back at the first game. It's aged, it's incontestable, examples of the clear aging include incomprehensible AI that seems to decide randomly if it will function correctly, and graphics that haven't help up entirely well most notably the CGI cutscenes. It's probably best to get the worst out of the way now, the story is utterly predictable and overall rather cliché, definitely not a story you'd get invested in. On a lighter note, gameplay has held up decently, the gunplay is implemented well with a variety of weaponry to choose from, the levels are pretty large and well laid out for the most part and facilitate various approaches to objectives. Honestly I'd recommend looking at some videos before you consider purchasing, you might not even necessarily like this if you're a fan of the subsequent Far Cry games.

reviewText:
Graphics are lovely with a real tropical feel to the game and a small amount of awe as you realise you can go anywhere on the maps, which are sometimes HUGE, Objectives are well paced and not confusing. There's no wandering around wondering what to do next.
The enemy AI is very good, especially considering the open nature of the game, often they will try to out-flank your position or simply get behind cover so you must then flush them out leading to some pretty tense moments. However, it's not perfect, sometimes you will see the bad guys rooted to the spot for an easy kill or they simply charge your well hidden position and it's a turkey shoot. If anything, the flaws in AI make the game easier which is preferable to the opposite situation!
The weapons are beautiful: a mix of real and futuristic improvements. Ammo is never really a problem (well, with the exception of the Sniper rifle bullets and the RPG loads when they would really tip the balance in your favour) and, most importantly, the damage they inflict is balanced: both enemies and player go down with about the same amount of damage. Where the game falls down is near the end when a couple of pointless nonsensical plot-twists ruin the story. The game 'ends' three times, with some ill-thought through extra levels tagged on each time.

reviewText:
As a fan of the Far Cry series, and a fan of games in general I think it would be a shame if you never try the Far Cry series. I am not one to argue what Far Cry is the best, I can at least say I think all the Far Cy games are pretty good.  I have not (as of this review) played the newest Far Cry, Far Cry 4.  I dont know what I liked most about the first Far Cry, I mean I liked the story and the gamplay equally. It might not be as memorable as some of the newer games, but its still worth a play.

I would recommend you try Far Cry if you are a fan of the newer games, and want to see where the series came from, or if you are looking for an older game to play. Heck even if you just want a new series under your belt, this is a good choice!

P.S. You should skip the Uwe Boll Far Cry movie, I'm serious.

reviewText:
2004 was a great year in PC gaming, and while many regard Half-Life 2 as the brightest star of that great year, I'd still rank Far Cry on top of that. The game was a masterpiece in engine technology, and features some of the most interesting level design in FPS gaming.

The weapons and the feeling of power they transfer to the hands of the gamer is of such a caliber (pun intended) that still hasn't been toppled by any game since. The Desert Eagle and M4 in Far Cry are quite simply the most enjoyable weapons in gaming.

The game doesn't come without flaws though. The game suffers from the 'Crytek disease', namely, that a large part of the game is considerably worse after the introduction of superhuman enemies.

In Crysis, it was the blue alien scum, which singlehandedly reduced the game to a bullet-spamming festival of bright lights, taking away all the interesting gameplay features.

In Far Cry, it is the trigens. That being said, I'd rather battle trigens over aliens any day, but shooting loud-mouthed mercs is still way more fun.

If you are interested in playing this masterpiece, by all means, play it with the FCAM 1.99 mod. It improves graphics, add more features and fixes bugs.

reviewText:
This game is, ahrd but fun. It isnt too open world, as you'll go through a storyline and encounter quite a few loading screens. But on the long run great. Find weapons and figure out ways to surprise people, anybody can run it, its 2004-2005 so the graphics arent to heavy, and are pretty good for that year to be honest. The interface is rather simple, and you can only save at checkpoints, not as Far Cry 2 or 3 where you can save where you want so it really does add a make sure you dont die feel to it. Its fast moving and you've got to have your wits about ya.

85/100
This is a well fleshed out game, but remember my score is opinion based so if you're not a huge fan of linear ish maps or being stealthy, then you may want to get this game when its on sale.

reviewText:
Makes one feel like Rambo: familiar FPS mechanics with diversions into a most excellent stealth jungle experience.

Ignoring the mediocre story, terrible acting, unlikeable characters and abysmal dialogue, the game flows nicely through a lengthly 20 chapters.

Without a built-in auto-save, Far Cry is incredibly challenging even on Easy mode. For those that don't want to rinse-repeat large sections of gameplay, load up the console and \save_game your way through tropical jungles, temples and bases, until that 30 second final cutscene reminds you of the game's weakpoints and you findyourself wishing that you could turn a gun on protagonist Jack Carver's own head for being such a d*bag.

- Skinny from the Fat B*stard (curator link)

reviewText: The best Far Cry game by far, and a really awesome FPS in general. The linear path you're given is so huge it doesn't really feel that linear, but instead presents to you many ways to approach your goal. The game also isn't short either, being at least a dozen hours in length. If you like shooters and trees, buy this game.

reviewText:
I'm not a big FPS fan but I really enjoyed this game. Got it cheap and had many hours of fun. I would the describe the levels as sandbox-corridors. The levels overall were fairly linear, but most levels had breathing room and were wide open for experimentation with the ways you could approach combat. There are plenty of opportunities for vehicle/boat-based combat, but I found navigating the vehicles too cumbersome to really enjoy driving and shooting at the same time (especially the land vehicles).
Played on Medium difficulty and it was definitively challenging. The game sometimes seems to steer you towards a stealth-based approach, but I didn't see any real mechanics to actually support stealth. Enemies could spot you really easily in thick brush or when you're far away, hear you even when you're approaching in crouch. and were ridiculously accurate when firing. Plus, you only carry a machete if you sacrifice a weapon spot. There really should've been a dedicated knife button or slot. So usually I would tag as many combatants as I could from afar with the binoculars, pick off the closest enemies or the most dangerous ones with available sniper ammo, rockets and grenades, and then charge in to mop up with the shotgun or machine guns. The game does a great job of slyly adding better weapons as the levels progress, so you never get too bored if you're paying attention and trying new guns. Used the TILDE key constantly to save the game via console. The auto-save spots were too infrequent.
I enjoyed the enemy variety. You start off fighting vanilla mercenaries, and the game introduces different enemies and varieties throughout. Fun addition to game was that one group of enemies was constantly fighting another, and they'd only pause battle so both could attack you. Levels that included three-way combat were great.
The story and characters are goofy fun. The way the game's plot reveals itself slowly over the 20-ish levels was well done, and maybe I'm dense but there was a twist near the end I didn't see coming. I was pleasantly surprised. The voice acting was hit and miss, but I thought the voice actor for Doyle the scientist did a great job, which is vital since he essentially narrates the game.
Played 30+ hours, experienced zero crashes or noticeable bugs. Very stable game. Graphics were great for a game this old, and I really enjoyed the overall look of the island/sea setting. Crytek's specialty is advanced graphics and its reputation is well earned here.
Give this game a chance if you haven't already, it's great fun. It's also a lengthy game so it's a great value proposition.

reviewText:
!!! SPOILERS !!!

Awesome game, especially the stealth aspect is very fun to play. The AI. is very glitchy at times, unfortunately, but other than that, the gameplay is good.
One of the disadvantages the game has is the Checkpoint save system, which unnecessarily increases the difficulty by a huge amount at some points As you progress through the game you follow a (very open, yet) linear path to various objectives that are pointed out on the map. At various keypoints, for example behind a base, a yards down the road, or at a roadblock the enemy put up. These are usually few and far between, *especially* in later levels of the game. As you activate the checkpoint by walking into it, instead of completing an objective (like killing the soldiers guarding the base (roadblock), it can happen that you accidentally save while on very low health. With a normal Save/Load system you would just reload an earlier checkpoint and try again to complete the section at higher health/armor, but this waqy you have to completely scavenge the base and all the surroundings for ammo and health/armor to at least have a chance at progressing through the game, as you WILL die very quickly, depending on your difficulty.

Apart from the save system, another flaw of the game is the steep difficulty curve. At one point in the game you will encounter so-called Trigens, mutated apes that will jump at you and can usually kill you in just under a few hits.
These can make it extremely hard to survive against other human enemies, just because they reduce you to such low health.

Another frustrating enemy appears much further in the plot: Giant mutants. With rocket launchers. That detect you from like 200m away. Afggdfgfdgdgsg.
These are so frustrating to kill, as they usually take like a million hits to kill, draining your ammo count (one time, I had to resort to grenades, as all my guns were completely out of ammo!)
Overall, the levels are well designed, though, and the rest of the gameplay makes up for those annoying details.
If I had to rate the game, I would give it an 8/10. 9/10 if the Save system was improved out of the box, that means more checkpoints and better placement of them, or a Quicksave/Quickload system, like in many other games.
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Hot damn this game is difficult.

For being 10 years old, it holds up pretty well though. The graphics aren't bad considering the age and the freedom you get  on how to tackle obstacles is pretty nice. The AI also tends to handle itself pretty well MOST of the time, such as trying to flank you and what not, but that doesn't mean they won't go charging through a door they just saw 4 of their buddies get gunned down in.

That being said though, this game is really freaking hard. The enemies have pin-point accuracy at almost all times and they can spot you from extremely far away, even if you're sneaking around. The stealth aspect is pretty rough sometimes, especially when enemies can see you through tents, which I understand is a bug. You die VERY QUICKLY and MULTIPLE TIMES in this game. Some situations are hair-pullingly difficult and require lots of patience to get through simply because of how strong the enemies are. Then the Mutants appear and the game really spikes in difficulty.  The boss fights are also completely ridiculous and definitely require an aspect of luck to get past.

The voice acting is super cheesy, and Jack Carver is a walking one-liner machine. The characters are one-dimensional and the story isn't really anything special. Most of the time I didn't even know why I was supposed to carry out my objectives, but I was having too much fun figuring out how to elimate a group of guards to have it bother me anyway.

All in all, this game is worth playing if you wanna see Far Cry's roots. When you're winning, this game is fun, but when you're dying your 50th time, you want to strangle a small child.

reviewText:
Hot damn this game is difficult.

For being 10 years old, it holds up pretty well though. The graphics aren't bad considering the age and the freedom you get  on how to tackle obstacles is pretty nice. The AI also tends to handle itself pretty well MOST of the time, such as trying to flank you and what not, but that doesn't mean they won't go charging through a door they just saw 4 of their buddies get gunned down in.

That being said though, this game is really freaking hard. The enemies have pin-point accuracy at almost all times and they can spot you from extremely far away, even if you're sneaking around. The stealth aspect is pretty rough sometimes, especially when enemies can see you through tents, which I understand is a bug. You die VERY QUICKLY and MULTIPLE TIMES in this game. Some situations are hair-pullingly difficult and require lots of patience to get through simply because of how strong the enemies are. Then the Mutants appear and the game really spikes in difficulty.  The boss fights are also completely ridiculous and definitely require an aspect of luck to get past.

The voice acting is super cheesy, and Jack Carver is a walking one-liner machine. The characters are one-dimensional and the story isn't really anything special. Most of the time I didn't even know why I was supposed to carry out my objectives, but I was having too much fun figuring out how to elimate a group of guards to have it bother me anyway.

All in all, this game is worth playing if you wanna see Far Cry's roots. When you're winning, this game is fun, but when you're dying your 50th time, you want to strangle a small child.

reviewText:
Far Cry was one of this games which I remember playing as a child. So I bought it on Steam and don´t regret it.

Short:

+Good gunplay, weapons feel strong.
+Tactic matters in taking out enemys.
+Good mix between linear and open world sections.
+Thinking outside the box will reward you.
+It´s looking pretty good for a 2004 game.

+/- ITS HARD AS ♥♥♥♥!
+/- Story is not really deep, but still cheesy enough to entertain me.

-AI sometimes goes full Cyborg-mode and see you through vegetation and geometry.
-Render distance is pretty low, AI will often attack you outside your watchable space. Using scopes is the only solution.
-At some points, enemy placement is simply unfair.
-I got stuck in geometries a couple of times, seems like just bad collider.


Long:

Far Cry is one of the last true old-school" games which means it is designed to be hard. If you want an easy shooter to kill some time
date: this is the wrong game for sure. To say it lightly you WILL die
recommended: a lot. For starters I recommend to play your first run on "easy"
hoursPlayed: even for hardcore shooter-fans. Because every difficulty setting has an invisible +1 on it

column17: especially when they somewhat go full ARMA 2 cyborg-mode and see you through obstacles and hit you with every shot at insanely distances.\nThe second flaw are bad colliders. I got stuck several times in different levels and sections
column18: which got me killed and that’s frustrating.\n\nWell every other aspect is not worth mentioning
column19: the music is okay

story is not great but cheesy which makes it okay.


So I would say:

reviewText:
I need to start off my review saying this. This game is balls to the walls difficult for an FPS. It is not forgiving and I was basically only able to beat this game by using a save game cheat. And that is basically the only part of this game that makes it unreplayable. Too be honest I found the gunplay to be quite fun. It is lacking as the enemies are complete bullet sponges, taking in up to a full clip from your M16. Guns in this game are neat, but it does focus on assault rifles. Other than three of them there are only enough weapons to fill the status quota of different types of weapons. Lacking? Yes. But still fun as I said earlier. The story of this game is quite...stupid. Government genetic testing. Bored yet? It is definetly not the reason you will be playiing the game. And neither will its claim to be an open world game. Maybe I just played the game wrong somehow but I found the world to be quite linear, with largish levels to trudge through. I started playing this game about the same time I started playing Far Cry 3 and...I was dissapointed. Now I know what you are saying, that I shouldn't be comparing it to a newer game, but to call this game open world seems like a sin to me, and made me glad we have 3.

Score: 6/10

It is worth it on sale and if you want to see how the series began. Or if youre a hardcore bada** who can take on the world. If you can kill every enemy in this game on one playthrough you are the ultimate gamer.

reviewText:
На РусскомРекомендую ли я эту игру? Конечно да!
Это один из сложнейших FPS шутеров, в который я играл.
Это первая игра на CryEngine.

Я хочу получить рабочий продукт. Скачал и играй, а не сиди битый час на форуме впустую.

На ПиндосскомDo I recommend this game? Of course yes!
It's one of the hardest FPS-shooter I've ever played!
It's a first game on CryEngine.

But what do I want to get after buying a game on Steam?
I do want to get a working product. Download&Play, not useless surfing the Internet searching solutions to make it work.
Yes, of course, this game being declared for WinXP, became outdated three times already.
Well, there is no sense in buying it on Steam.

reviewText:
Truly a classic.
Graphics are respectable, especially considering this came out in 2004.  I'm sure this game was melting rigs back then.
Story isn't half bad.  Dialogue is cheesy though.
Good variety of weapons and a great soundtrack.
But...
The difficulty.  I've never died so much.  The lack of a save besides autosave adds to the difficulty, and this game is truly difficult.  On realistic, I would almost advise taking blood pressure medication since it literally is die, repeat, die, repeat, die, repeat (you're like tom cruise in edge of tomorrow). There was maybe like two sections between autosaves where I did not die multiple times throughout the entire game.  AI not only has x-ray vision, but can headshot you from 200m away with a pistol through walls/tents/bunkers.  Driving vehicles will also give you cancer.

Despite all that though, it's still quite enjoyable.  It's a real challenge unlike many current games which feel dumbed down.
Highly recommended.

reviewText: One of the best looking games ever made. Sound effects are amazing as well, dialogue is cheesy but fits the theme of the game. Plenty of enemy variety, although some are overpowered with being able to move too fast and having impossibly precise aim. Stealth is encouraged with plenty of ways to hide and be silent when killing. Going in gung ho usually does not work due to the overwhelming number of enemies that can be in the area. Long campaign, although it does get repetitive after a while and rewards you with a sudden and anticlimatic ending. Boss fights are challenging but not profoundly epic. Vehicles are fun to use and control fairly well. It can be a pain having to trouble long distances without a vehicle, which may happen from time to time. Use the console for saving because the checkpoints are way too far apart. The franchise has come a long way but if you're interested in its roots like I was it is a fun adventure through the jungle. 8.0/10

reviewText:
Classic FPS shooter game in every traditional sense of the word.
Nothing really complicated in the way of having to use any special powers
and abilities.
No nanosuit like in Crysis to go invisible and increase your strength.
No teammates to help you out when going gets tough.
It's just you and your ability to outshoot and outrun your opponents.
Or try to sneak past them.
Excellent graphics for it's time but obviously outdated now.

Also what makes this game really worth having is the many custom mods
and maps that are available to download for it.
If you like the older action games like SOF,Delta Force series etc. then
this game should be on your wanted list.

In addition to human enemies there is an extra challenge in the form of
monsters created as a result of a mad scientists genetic experiments.
And these creatures are tougher than the mercenaries.
So beware and have fun shooting your enemies and getting killed in
return.
Make sure your character obtains a good life insurance policy because
chances are his lifespan will be short which may be either bad or blessing
for his beneficiaries.

reviewText: The graphics still hold surprisingly well, and I am still amazed at how immersive the island setting can be.  Despite beign set in a tropical island similar to Crysis and Far Cry 2, Far Cry manages to create its own mood. reviewText:
In Far Cry, you play the role of Jack Carver, a sailor who finds himself stranded on an uncharted, tropical island. As you fight your way back to civilization, you'll deal with forces both human and beastly.

If nothing else, Far Cry is the epitome of a predatory game - stealth, patience, and planning are pivotal to your survival. It's a game with heavy emphasis on stalking your prey, outsmarting them, and picking them off, one by one. It's an exhilarating and rewarding feeling unparalleled by many other games. For this sole reason, Far Cry deserves high marks.

On a less positive note, Far Cry can be often times frustrating. While the maps are diverse, ranging from open world to tight corridors, the latter will often place you in ridiculously tough situations. You'll likely find yourself unfairly surrounded by enemies and dying plenty. It also doesn't help that the AI is subpar. Their occasional illogical behavior adds needless difficulty to an already difficult game.

Grade: B+

reviewText:
This game still looks beautifull!
Even though this game is over 10 years old, it still looks beautiful. The graphics is actually so good, that is outshines some games released a decade later. But, there is always a butt! It takes too long before the story begins, and when it does, it is not very good. The A.I. is very stupid, and clearly programmed to not see you while you are moving in the vegetation. Other than that, they have no problems spotting you trough tents, bunkers and walls. They are also able to spot you further away than you can see, so you will have to use the binoculars to see who is shooting at you. I do not get the part with the mutants, it just feels weird. Other than that the game is pretty entertaining. The levels are a mix between “open world” (semi-open world with different paths that leading to the same goal) and linear. The game mechanics are good, which makes the game enjoyable. The hitboxes are good for a game this old, and you are rewarded for steady aim. The variation in weapons is not great, but it is good enough (should have been more weapons with silencer).

All in all this is a alright game and I think it deserves a score of 6,5/10. This is a good buy, if you can get it for a discounted price, or in a bundle.

Weapon of choice: Mouse and keyboard
Difficulty: Challenging
Resolution: 1920x1080
Graphics: All max

reviewText:
A short story  about this game. before i do the review. First thing i remeber was i watched my friends brother play this game back in elmentary school , when i was around 9 or 10 and so i might have played some very few minutes back then but i can`t remember. I remeber I bought this july 2009 along with cod 2 somewhere in Germany in a super market. I finished cod 2 i was probably one of few in my classes that played the orignal cod games and didnt start and jump on the bandwagon on either mw 1 or for the most part in my class mw 2. However i bought far cry 1 and got to the last part of the game and never managed to do it if i recall correctly , before i had to unistall it. So i decided to take with me my far cry cd to my small house for the holiday and try and play it again. Ofc my cd didnt work, but i had  luck that it was 75% of steam so to re buy it digital instead of using my old vista computer and burn my far cry cd to another cd , as i couldnt until i get home anyway , i decided why the hell i can now have this digitally.

So now we are around 7 years later and i finally managed to completed this. So how does it hold up compared to then.  Well i recalled alot of the locations from when i played particaly the last location and some of the locations mid way trough the game eiter way:

Good:
- Gameplay, u can stealth some parts if you want to, you can plan your approach most of the times, and most of the levels has multiple solutions or multiple routes to take.
- Good soundtrack
- Great level desing
- Great gunplay.
- Its hard even on normal

Decent :
- Voice acting
- Story , it would be on bad if this was anything but an fps , but you dont exept a fps do have good story and the story is actully pretty decent

Bad
- Enemy line of sight can sometimes be bit weird but usually works just fine.
Beside that not much

Rating 9/10
One of my favorite fps along with cod 2, mw 1, medal of honor frontline, half life 1 and even far cry 2 ( yeah i  know i am one of the few who really liked it)   ( Deus ex if that counts to)

Probably had more fun with this then far cry 3 too.
Total play time if you excl my steam version i guess  around 25 hrs. I was far worse on fps 7 years ago then i am now.
I rarely play fps these days but this one is recommend.

reviewText:
As a fan of retro games, I grabbed this game on sale since friends said it was a good game. That nails it: it WAS a good game back in the days.

But first off, the good things: This game was simple, dumb fun most of the times. Let me tell you why.

Most importantly, shooting in this game is really fun since you get a nice load of guns, binoculars and a working stealth system. Pretty well done for a game of this age. There's some vehicles you can drive which is kinda fun, too. Your enemies aren't entirely stupid either and there's a whole lot of different enemy types, adding enough variety to keep you entertained.

The story is ridiculously dumb and cliché (yeah, this is a good thing IMO). The typical random guy who turns out to be a born killing machine and badass (you), the hot" sidekick babe (unfortunately not as hot as the developers think she is) and of course
hoursPlayed: narcissistic and ubermensch-creating Doctor Krieger. The plot is so dumb it's actually funny
voteText: so I guess it's alright as it is. Whoever buys this game can't possibly be expecting a deep story anyway

This game is old

reviewText:
Far Cry is a great game. But it's also rather funny, and I have to attribute that to the hysterical and wise-♥♥♥ narration of Jack Carver with ridiculous one-liners you'd expect from an 80's action film starring Arnie or Sly.

Jack Carver is a former US Army Special Forces who left society in the States to run a boating business in the South Pacific. The game opens with a cut scene of a client, 'journalist Val Cortez', taking off on a jet ski as Jack and Val near a mysterious island. Jack's boat is then shot down by a rocket and a cinematic shows Jack swimming towards shore, running through some jungles as mysterious creatures are running wild and gunfire is everywhere. You can tell right away that this game is going to be action packed. Once Jack finds a large, crashed boat, he swims into the hull and that's where the gameplay starts.

The gameplay is simple, you are on a massive island, levels varying in size and openness. You can prone and stealth your way through, or use trees and misc. objects for cover while getting into a firefight. There are sniper rifles, rocket launcher, various assault rifles, pistols, loads of weapons really. You can find vehicles to drive and plow your way through, or find a boat to take down a river instead of going head on with the enemy. The game is about different choices in paths, mainly when outside. If indoors, like in a cave or building, it's secluded to one path.

The enemies include the soldiers, taking orders from the menacing Dr. Krieger, the doctor, of course, is also experimenting in human genetics and you will also face these dangerous monsters called Trigen. They vary in size and strength.

I will say that I was mostly impressed by the gameplay and graphics. Especially the amount of flora and life in the jungle. I'm talking about insects, birds, butterflies, etc. All very cool.

The story was interesting, but also a little generic in the action/sci-fi trope. Evil scientist experimenting with human genomes, former US SF saves the day, one-liners, some CIA involvement (Doyle, the man who talks to you from the cell phone you find), and a twist ending. It's all very familiar material from cheesey 80's action films. But it's still funny and still interesting.

The game gets a solid 9.0/10 though. For the depth of the level designing and gameplay. Story was good enough.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Crouch, sneak, sneak, sneak.  Knife kill.
Crouch, sneak, sneak, sneak.  Sniper kill.
Crouch, sneak, sneak, sneak, repeat Sniper kill until you run out of sniper ammo.

Jump in enemy jeep and kill everyone with the heavy machine gun mounted on the back.

Crouch sneak, sneak, sneak,  Run really fast to get as close as you can and unload with your assault rifle until everyone is dead but you.  Use hang glider to sneak up on enemy outpost.  Throw Grenade and wait for explosion, plant C-4 and wait for explosion, use bazooka to blow up enemy helicopter.

Run around shooting people until your eyes are so tired and bloodshot that you can't blink anymore.

Rat -a- tat tat. Rat -a- tat tat.  BOOM!

Repeat  the above until you win the game.

If this sounds like fun to you, then this game will get the job done.  A real challenge.

reviewText:
Far cry is an open world FPS, the game is 11 years old, but it still holds up, but its not all fine and dandy.
You play as Jack Carver, a former special forces soldier who is hired by a woman named Val, investigating a strange island, all the sudden the boat is attacked and Jack is beign hunted down by mercs. i wont give to much spoilers because at the end of the game there is a HUGE plot twist. First lets talk GRAPHICS. For 2004, this game looks great, the water is the most impresive part of the game, yep the water. (I Think Half-Life 2 Looks Better) Gameplay is standard FPS shizz, you shoot things. the weapons are generic but some are kewl. the starting weapon is a deagle, and the first rifle you get is the generic M4 carbine, soon you get a sniper rifle, rocket launcher and other stuff, there is a upgraded version of the m4 that has a grenade launcher, but the 3 best weapons are the following, The Shotgun, fully auto-matic and takes out bad guys quickly at close range, the OICW, the best assault rifle, semi auto grenade launcher, and scoped. The most BAD ♥♥♥ weapon is the Negev, the FMG is op, you get it towards the end of the game. Now lets talk about the difficulty



FAR CRY IS HARD


Even on normal this game is difficult, but the biggest offender is

THERE ARE NO QUICKSAVES

open the console using the ~` key and type, \save_game
that will quicksave, YOU WILL NEED IT SON.

Hey! How Was That FPS Game With No Quicksaves? Said No One Ever" - gggmanlives

Overall Far cry is a great game

voteText: however the main issues are no quicksaving and the difficulty

reviewText:
Had not ever played far cry 1, and taking the year released into consideration this is a game well worth the 10 bucks. You can see where they made improvements as the series went on but the maps are pretty large. Still feels like its open world fsp almost. The aiming is a bit awkward, some AI detect you pretty easy but some of the AI should get some credit the meter did not rise until they actually saw me. Some must of used the force to detect my movements.

For map size I would argue it rivals the later Far crys and fallouts though it is very empty/repetitive map and they did add a lot more later on. The story thus far is kinda cheesy. The graphics on max look comparable to late ps2 early ps3 graphics id say. I've heard there are enhacements which I am just using the stock version so with those who knows what kind of graphics you could get. So yeah of course nothing is going to make you go wow but the game doesn't quite feel 11 years old.

One interesting note I'd like to make the game comes with an option to add mods on and switch between the modded version and original version on the main menu which in my opinion is awesome. Of course you have to find the mods yourself but still.

If you haven't played the game and like open world fps games then this is a good idea to play!
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Ok, before people asking why I make a review to a game in which I have 0 hours...
I played this already hundreds of hours I guess. Not on Steam and with mods. FCAM mostly.
Back when I played it, it wasnt even on Steam and I played one of the first proper 64Bit games, with patch.

You are Jack Carver and you are on a trip to a island.
Unexptected your companion disappears and you get attacked by mercs. You have to escape onto the island.
You are swimming and a grenade explosion underwater throws you into a tunnel and you get unconscious.
You wake up in a old sewer and need to escape. You fast meet a guy called Doyle which seems to want to help you.
He gives you cordinates and tips how to survive and what to do. So your trip over the big island starts.

The gameplay is a classical FPS shooter. Located in a openworld tropical island most of the time. You have several wespons like a knife, pistol, machine gun or sniper to fight against the enemies. You will meet many on your way over the island and the interesting is that they are quite inteligent, especially for old 2004 enemies. There also some sort of mutant enemies next to the typical mercs but those come later into the game. You also have some sort of spy glasses to mark enemies on your map marker or just check the situation. On your way you sometimes also can use cars. Thats pretty much it. Simple but extremely well made, especially for 2004.

The engine is the CryEngine. Back in 2004 this was one of the best looking games out then and it really changed the way of FPS shooters. Well, notably together with HL2 which came out around the same time.
Also this was the first game of a German developer named Crytek. Which is also known for the Crysis series.
This game has nothing to do with the Ubisoft Far Cry games like 2,3,4.
The only thing they have in common is that they are FPS. Dont make this mistake please!

The graphics are extremely good for the time and even today it somewhat still looks good or decent at least.
All graphic options you can imagine are ingame. There are even Render options ingame with that you can let the game for example look like a cartoon game! Rarely I seen such options in games! Far Cry turns into Borderlands. Also sound settings are extremely advanced! Extremely good and well made PC game. There is also a 64Bit patch available. You need to install it extra though. I personally recommend using the mod FCAM instead. Delivers pretty much the same graphical enhancements. On the top there are even more graphical improvements. This mod really pushes the engine to its real limit. Even my HD 5870 some years ago couldnt handle it on 60FPS on maxed settings, 1080p and 4xAA. For the fact that the game was like 6 years or more old this was astonishing. FCAM also adds proper ironisghts which work really good! Also it fixes many of the annoying bugs like enemies which can shoot through objects and hit you...
FCAM is a must have! Even for first time players! Grab the latest 1.999 version on moddb guys!

Positive:
- Old but gold!
- Pretty good PC game, technically speaking
- Really good FPS experience
- Challenging difficulty, good enemy AI
- No regenerating health!
- Great graphics with many options
- Mod FCAM makes the game even better and makes it perfect"
- Crytek! Because yes!

Negative:
- Difficulty is high
- Multiplayer is dead as of 2014. Gamespy is down but it was never played that much in MP anyway

Replayability: High

Rating: 9.5/10
In my opinion this is totally one of the best games ever made.
Rarely I played a game so often
date: especially after so many years.\nDefinitely a big part of gaming history
recommended: especially on PC.\nAlso mods like FCAM improve it so much!\nWhat are you waiting for? BUY IT!"

reviewText:
Its been a long time since I played an FPS game, so I thought why not give FarCry a try. I've never played a FarCry before , nor seen any playthroughs of it. So I went at this one blind and simply said it exceeded  my expectations.

This is not a game that you raise your gun and run through without taking your share of fire. On the contrary you take fire and suffer multiple deaths througout the game. FarCry forces you to use tactics to survive.The AI can be brutal at times utilizing actual tactics to hunt you down and kill you. It is a common ocurocurrence to get cut down by a sniper , walk into an ambush , or get caught up in crossfire. Often times the mercs will distract you with a 3 man squad while the fourth member is creeping silently to flank and destroy you.

You must use stealth , cover, and keep your *** down in the bush or you will certainly wind up dead. Throughout the game I would crawl  through the jungle to avoid contact as long as I could. Recon is a must in FarCry , if you go into an enemy camp unprepared you are dead. Even the best trained soldier dies if he is unprepared , so remember to recon and  take the best weapon synergies possible into the fight. You must learn to adapt as the batlle will shift from jungle to corridor frequently.

FarCry forced me into a very slow methodical pace , and as such may not be for everyone. I really enjoyed playing FarCry and it renewed my interest in FPS games again. If you are the kind of gamer who enjoys a real challenge then I would highly recomend that you give FarCry a play. FarCry is filled with many interesting twists and as a result I never really knew when it was going to end. As I've said before If you are not very careful you will die alot." Try not to get frustrated FarCry was intended to be difficult. If you should survive until the endgame hopefully you will have found FarCry a rewarding experience. I highly recommend FarCry to people who appreciate a challenge in an FPS."

reviewText:
Its been a long time since I played an FPS game, so I thought why not give FarCry a try. I've never played a FarCry before , nor seen any playthroughs of it. So I went at this one blind and simply said it exceeded  my expectations.

This is not a game that you raise your gun and run through without taking your share of fire. On the contrary you take fire and suffer multiple deaths througout the game. FarCry forces you to use tactics to survive.The AI can be brutal at times utilizing actual tactics to hunt you down and kill you. It is a common ocurocurrence to get cut down by a sniper , walk into an ambush , or get caught up in crossfire. Often times the mercs will distract you with a 3 man squad while the fourth member is creeping silently to flank and destroy you.

You must use stealth , cover, and keep your *** down in the bush or you will certainly wind up dead. Throughout the game I would crawl  through the jungle to avoid contact as long as I could. Recon is a must in FarCry , if you go into an enemy camp unprepared you are dead. Even the best trained soldier dies if he is unprepared , so remember to recon and  take the best weapon synergies possible into the fight. You must learn to adapt as the batlle will shift from jungle to corridor frequently.

FarCry forced me into a very slow methodical pace , and as such may not be for everyone. I really enjoyed playing FarCry and it renewed my interest in FPS games again. If you are the kind of gamer who enjoys a real challenge then I would highly recomend that you give FarCry a play. FarCry is filled with many interesting twists and as a result I never really knew when it was going to end. As I've said before If you are not very careful you will die alot." Try not to get frustrated FarCry was intended to be difficult. If you should survive until the endgame hopefully you will have found FarCry a rewarding experience. I highly recommend FarCry to people who appreciate a challenge in an FPS."

reviewText:
Had not ever played far cry 1, and taking the year released into consideration this is a game well worth the 10 bucks. You can see where they made improvements as the series went on but the maps are pretty large. Still feels like its open world fsp almost. The aiming is a bit awkward, some AI detect you pretty easy but some of the AI should get some credit the meter did not rise until they actually saw me. Some must of used the force to detect my movements.

For map size I would argue it rivals the later Far crys and fallouts though it is very empty/repetitive map and they did add a lot more later on. The story thus far is kinda cheesy. The graphics on max look comparable to late ps2 early ps3 graphics id say. I've heard there are enhacements which I am just using the stock version so with those who knows what kind of graphics you could get. So yeah of course nothing is going to make you go wow but the game doesn't quite feel 11 years old.

One interesting note I'd like to make the game comes with an option to add mods on and switch between the modded version and original version on the main menu which in my opinion is awesome. Of course you have to find the mods yourself but still.

If you haven't played the game and like open world fps games then this is a good idea to play!

reviewText:
Probably the most difficult FPS I've ever played. But it's also probably one of the better FPS games I've experienced because it never really felt repetitive to me, unlike other games of the same genre.

You need to adopt a methodical apporach, be wary of your surroundings, and be a crack shot in order to progress through each level. You can't just dive in and spray like scarface every single time. That's not gonna cut it in this one.

I'd recommend buying on discount due to some bugs and (from what I heard) multiplayer being dead. But if you're an avid FPS player, this is a goodie to have with 20 levels,12-15 hours of gameplay, and the open world.

Oh,and whoever designed the last level in this game is a sadist.

reviewText:
The game is still as fun as I remember it was 10 years ago.
A classic FPS with a bit of a cheesy/cliche story that will test your abilities to plan ahead in battle (well, not that much)!
In this game you won't just be charging blindly into battle while your infinite health regenerates, nope, you'll need to plan stuff out, tag enemies, conserve bullets a bit, it's awesome!

Go buy it, if you're a fan of HARD shooters. Graphics are also pretty good, amazing even for something that's 10 years old (at the time of writing)!!


Other pros include:
- a semi-open world, you can explore all you want but you won't gain anything from it (at least I didn't find anything significant).

- some pretty funny one liners from enemies at times, you  will  be that guy in the shirt, whose ♥♥♥ is surely grass by now.

- a somewhat creepy/scary atmosphere at times.

- the difficulty, yes, I can't stress this one enough. It's HARD, and that just makes it that much more awesome!



...the guy in the shirt!"/10"

reviewText:
Unfortunately the steam version ships with the infamous 1.4 patch which breaks the A.I making them much harder than they originally was;  and this game is pretty hard compared to newer Far Cry games and this makes the game alot less fun and makes stealth nearly impossible, heck it makes certain sections of the game nearly impossible since the A.I can shoot at you with high accuracy at long distances, even through walls with high accuracy too.

In order to play the game without the AI super soldiers, you need the unofficial patchs or somehow downgrade to patch 1.3

Now, I remember playing this back in 2004 and thought it was originally a good game, because back then-  Far Cry WAS a good game, but the standards have risen considerably over the years and this game shows cleary how low gamers standards was back then.

Far Cry suffers from a huge amount of general issues which makes the game generally much harder than it really needs to be, such as troop placement being so specific to catch the player out, each mission as such is more about remembering where enemy mercs are; rather than planning a strategic attack- think of MOH; Sniper Alley style gameplay here, its frustrating and needless.

Then to add further insult to injury, you have to put up with Carver being a complete tool in the gun accuracy department, his accuracy with weapons is excruciating bad, whilst the mercs have near perfect accuracy, this is why there are liberally scattered health packs and armor around because its nearly impossible not to take hits.   The accuracy is poor, imagine an artifical spray and pray - the gun cursor is just a 'basic' indicator where the bullets will go, not nessarily where you are pointing.  The gun sights offer slightly better accuracy but still, not good enough considering the accuracy of the mercs and traps.

Even with some much needed mods like FCam; the game is still a huge chore to play and saving after every encounter with mercs is essential- forget using stealth tactics...if you want working stealth, install Far Cry 2 and skip this.

As for the difficulty, there is honestly very little difference between easy and realistic difficultly - thats how hard this game is; realistic mode is just mostly for masochists who enjoy dying alot, or  who have played the game so much they have remembered the exact layout of the merc placements.

reviewText: I was wondering how long it would take for me to find a game that was really not worth my time. Farcry made me cry, a lot. So let's get into this.\n\nFar Cry is not a game where the story was generally well thought out. They throw you onto an island paradise" where your character
recommended: was vacationing. From there something random happens and you have to fight through mercenaries in order to get contact with scientist named Doyle. Your character immediately trusts Doyle for no reason and then proceeds to fight through random monkey mutants and mercenaries in order to rescue a woman I still know nothing about. In short the story doesn't really make sense and is full of plot holes. Often the characters do things blindly or through the power of male female attraction. If the three characters do know each other then it's not well established. The story feels barely stitched together and thus is easily the weakest part of the game. It simply doesn't make sense
hoursPlayed: less so than many call of duty campaigns.\nFrom a sound design perspective the game is fairly unremarkable. Be ready for weak audio cues and sound effects that don't really match the actions of the characters. When a main character gets shot in a bullet proof vest he will basically Wilhelm scream
voteText: the enemies shout the same five taunts at you. All the weapons have compressed unrealistic sound effects and generally speaking the OST seems to be the same five tracks. If it isn't
helpfulPercent: then they all sound the exact same. This game did not impress in the sound department.\nThe game mechanics are frankly broken. I've seen alot about this actually and it seems this is the result of a bad patch but it still made the game barely playable. Only a few of the guns actually are usable. The AI is ridiculous
votesHelpful: stealth (though introduced as a mechanic) is not functional. Trigins will kill you in a single hit
votesTotal: and the game's version of a difficulty curve is simply to throw more and more enemies at you at a time. It never gets more challenging from a skill perspective; it just throws more of the same challenge at you until the end of the game. The armor mechanic is okay at best
votesFunny: as it does give you more hit points and the sprint meter and crouching / going prone works fairly well to stabilize weapons and focus aim. However the game also suffers from bad vehicles. The vehicles are nearly un-drivable due to their half first person camera viewing. The third person viewpoint actually makes the car more un-drivable. In any case the vehicles require you to drive and shoot at the same time
commentsCount: and this just make sit incredibly hard not to crash into everything and incredibly hard to kill anything in a vehicle while moving. Far Cry also will spawn in helicopters ontop of your character providing instant death. The game is also prone to glitches such as bullets not activating collision detection
column16: enemies shooting through walls
column17: enemies freezing
column19: as well as many others.  Finally the game does attempt two boss fights. One of these is very easy and hardly of note and the second one broken. When fighting Crow on the freight ship
column20: the game has you fight a heavily buffed helicopter with a rocket launcher. The helicopter can take 15 rockets and Crow has a mini-gun that can shred your armor and health instantly. You can see how this is broken as heck...\nPresentation however is where Far Cry earns some credit. The level designs tend to be functional and original in the late game. They show a level of creativity that takes you from tree top testing facilities to a massive volcano. Each of these levels provides ample cover and weapons (disregarding the enemy game play of course). Also the graphics actually look fairly decent. As a game from 2004
column21: on high setting the water looks phenomenal and the game itself is pretty average. The FMV cut scenes
column23:
are also fairly good for FMV of the time. In short the presentation of Far Cry was its saving grace and actually gave me something to look forward to in each level.
So now to summarize...

Pros:
- Average FMV cut scenes
- Strong level variety and design
- Strong enemy variety
- Average graphics for 2004
- Satisfying boat level because only the boats aren't broken

Cons:
- Forgettable and repetitive OST
- Poor use of SFX
- Prone to major glitches
- Most of the guns are unusable
- Poorly implemented mechanics
- Bipolar AI.
- Constant instant kills from enemies.
- Broken boss fights and helicopter spawning
- Dam.
- Nonsensical story
- Generally bad one liners and forgettable characters

For you completionists in the crowd this game is not for you. While easy to complete in the sense that it has no "new game plus" or bonuses beyond beating it on normal
column24: it's still a pain due to how broken it is. Be prepared to get angry. Some levels are broken due to the enemies being hyper intelligent. Dam is an excellent example of this because the player character has no basic melee attack and the game only gives you a machine gun with ten bullets. You will die over and over again at this point hopelessly running through hundreds of tirgins attempting to reach a checkpoint. There are other moments like this that are breathtakingly bad but I don't have all the space to recount them. For completing the game you will unlock mods and statistics mode. Mods are useable as there was a modding community for the game
column25: however I haven't a clue if there is one that fixes the issues with the 1.4 patch. Statistics mode is the exact same game with a few additions like a kill counter and an accuracy rating at the end of the level. While it's nice that Ubisoft added a completion bonus to the game
column26: this bonus really offers no new content and really isn't worth the trouble. If you hated this game once
column27: you’re not going to love it because of statistics. So to conclude i'd give this game a 4.2 out of 10 (as it did have its moments and honestly wasn't the worst thing I’ve ever touched) and a completionist rating of Plook at it!\n"

reviewText:
Well, first of all, this game is hard, very hard even on the easiest difficulty. Having said that, for a 2004 game, the graphics look stunning.

I must add that it is strongly recommended to use the Iron Sights mod when you are playing this game. The in-game ADS is far from perfect and by using this mod, this would greatly enhance your gameplay.

If you are a die hard FPS fan who is looking for a challenge, I highly recommend this game. However this game is simply not for the casual gamer. Only hardcore FPS gamers need to apply due to its difficulty.
